item.title: Godswords -- made everything cept this problem help please
item.dc:creator: @kristjan1 kristjan*
item.description:
@kristjan1 wrote:

This is because you don’t add this ‘itemTwoHanded[ID] = true;’ there. Delete this part and it will be ok.

Let it be like that,

FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/twohanded.dat")); while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) { if (c == 0) itemTwoHanded[counter] = false; else itemTwoHanded[counter] = true; counter++; } dataIn.close(); itemTwoHanded[15332] = true; itemTwoHanded[15333] = true; itemTwoHanded[15334] = true; itemTwoHanded[14335] = true;

Read full topic

item.title: Godswords -- made everything cept this problem help please
item.dc:creator: @killa4444 killa4444
item.description:
@killa4444 wrote:

im having a problem here…

FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/twohanded.dat")); while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) { if (c == 0) itemTwoHanded[counter] = false; else itemTwoHanded[counter] = true; counter++; } dataIn.close(); itemTwoHanded[ID] = true; itemTwoHanded[15332] = true; itemTwoHanded[15333] = true; itemTwoHanded[15334] = true; itemTwoHanded[14335] = true;

if that looks right then something is wrong because my compiler says ::

item.java:125: cannot find symbol symbol: variable id location: class item itemTwoHanded[ID] = true ^ [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 29, 2008, 04:48:08 AM[/size][hr]i think i have to change
[ID] into something eles but i have yet to figure out what
